39477975.review:
Interessant co-op spel met unieke gameplay. Erg leuk om met vrienden samen op de bank te spelen, maar ik denk dat er in je eentje niet zoveel aan is. 

+Pluspunten+
+ Behoorlijk intense co-op. Samenwerking is belangrijk en je moet goed kunnen afstemmen met je vrienden wie wat doet om het schip in leven te houden
+ Aardig wat levels. Ik denk dat we met 10 uur spelen nog niet eens door alle levels heen waren. 
+ Mooie graphics en een leuke, levendige art-style
+ Interessante uitdagingen en continu nieuwe vijanden en levels die je geboeid houden

-Minpunten-
- In je eentje is er waarschijnlijk niet zo veel aan. Ik heb het zelf niet geprobeerd in singleplayer maar als ik het zo bekijk is dit spel echt ontworpen voor meerdere mensen
- Geen online co-op, alleen lokaal. Je hebt dus meerdere controllers nodig
- Niet veel herspeelbaarheidswaarde. Als je alle levels uitgespeeld hebt, is er niet erg veel reden om het opnieuw te doen.

Dus, ja. Kopen als je houdt van een chaotisch co-op spel met je vrienden. Als je geen vrienden hebt, raad ik het af.

39076787.review:
It's clear to see why Lovers in a Dangerous Spacetime is universally acclaimed. Besides the pun, it's an imaginative game that is designed for couch co-op with up to 4 players. It's got a loveably charming visual style, great music and mostly fun setpieces. But in my opinion, it is flawed. The first 2 worlds are fun, fast-paced and chaotic even with only 1 other player. The 3rd world starts to become slow, tedious and meandering. Lots of enemies you can't kill, or even can't hit unless you bring them close to a sun. 

The 3rd world boss uses all these new, frustrating mechanics and throws them at you while you TRY to hit him within a very short timeframe while also trying to dodge a bunch of stuff. This is super frustrating when you only have 2 people and you want to be moving the ship to have a good angle to line up shots, you want to then shoot him in the short vulnerability frames, while also using the shield to deflect the 2 or 3 cardinal directions from which the sun, icicles, his legs and body are all coming at you from. With 4 people I could see this being a breeze because you can cover most ground while also taking advantage and doing the most amount of damage after making the boss vulnerable. With 2 people there's about 5 seconds for every minute where you get to do anything other than fly around and dodge. You're also waiting for him to throw out a sun this whole time because otherwise you literally can't do anything to him.

Anyway, that's so far the worst part of the game and it's one that only seems relevant with 1 or 2 players. Everything before that ranges from enjoyable to amazing. If all you want to do is play a pleasant co-op experience with a friend or partner... I think there's better games out there. If you have 3 other people then you will probably love this wholeheartedly throughout Lovers runtime. Me? I liked it. It's good but imperfect. So I recommend it with that warning of difficulty spikes and exercises in tedium.

38815838.review:
[h1]PORTUGUÊS [/h1]

O jogo é ótimo. Sério. Uma boa jogabilidade, uma história simples mas cativante. Um design interessante. Mas o único fator que realmente faz perder um pouco da graça é de o multiplayer ser apenas local. Eu e um amigo jogamos uma vez no computador e a gente curtiu pra caramba, então na promoção de fim de ano nós dois compramos achando que tinha online (erro nosso, pois na página do jogo realmente diz que não tem online). 

Apesar de toda a qualidade do jogo e o fato de ele ser muito divertido com outras pessoas, esse pequeno detalhe estraga um pouco a diversão da coisa. Afinal, a gente realmente queria poder jogar juntos e não é sempre que podemos ir na casa um do outro pra jogar. Eu realmente espero que eles arrumem esse pequeno detalhe em alguma versão futura.

[h1] ENGLISH [/h1]

The game is great. Really. Nice gameplay, simple story but still good. An interesting design. But the only thing that makes it lose some of the fun part is that the multiplayer it's just local. Me and my friend played once in my computer and we liked a lot, so in the final year's promotion we both bought the game thinking that there was an online multiplayer (our mistake, cause the game's page says that there's no online).

Although all the game's quality and the fact that it's really funny with other people, this tiny detail ruins some of the fun. After all, we really wanted to play together and it isn't always that we will be able to go each other's house. I really hope that they fix this tiny detail in some future update.

38116041.review:
[b] Do You Have a Friend? Do you hate that Person?[/b]

But seriously, Lovers in a Dangerous Spacetime, aside from being a fun name to say, is an odd game. I would recommend it but with one or two caveats. The big one, like, really big, is that you should probably have some friends to play it with. There is single player, and it is pretty fun, but frankly I'm not sure the single player alone is worth $15. If you have friends you can play this with regularly (I must point out it's local only) it is a riot. While you can have up to 4 people playing at once, given who hard that it to pull off, the game thankfully plays great with just you and a friend, although be warned, it will get difficult. Trying to balance all of the parts of the ship to keep things moving slowly is hard, it get easier the more people who have, and with 4 the game is a cakewalk.
If you're looking for a fun game to play with your friend or friends, give this one a grab, because it is fun, a lot of fun. You may even get a kick out of the solid single player.

ポップな見た目とは裏腹にシューティングとしては硬派なつくりです。1人でもプレイできますが、操船と銃座を行ったり来たりするのがたいへんなので2人以上でプレイした方がより楽しめます。4人の場合は1人を操船専属にすればかなり楽に進めるんじゃないでしょうか。

3種類のジェムによるパワーアップの組みあわせがおもしろい。また、必殺兵器のヤマトキャノンでザコ敵を一掃する爽快感もあり。プレイ中の実績に応じていくつかの機体バリエーションがアンロックされる仕組みなので、リプレイ性もあります。

シナリオ(星座)は4つ。それぞれに設定されたマップとギミック、個性的なボスキャラがプレイヤーを待っています。

パーティゲームとしても楽しめると思いますよ。

37582357.review: 《Lovers in a Dangerous Spacetime》的界面非常可爱，玩家要从反派机器人手里拯救一群萌物，用激光击退金属水母，然后在各种无用尝试后和同伴一起奔赴游戏结局——挂掉。过于卡哇伊可能让人们忽略这个悲情结局。但是，游戏始终不过是延缓死亡的到来。 　　我和一个临时搭档在玩这个游戏时要拯救鸟类和兔子的星球免遭机器人入侵，还要抵御我们的宇宙飞船周围的攻击。玩家利用手柄的两个按钮和摇杆操作飞船进行攻击、防御和闪躲。一人跳进驾驶座进行负责闪躲，另一人则负责攻击和防御事宜。飞行时界面上会出现小鸟或兔子对话框，指引“恋人”前往它们的星球驱逐入侵者。完成后这些动物会献上一份爱心感谢你——当然就是人物健康值和飞船升级。推荐

37538465.review:
You and your friends each play as a pilot that can control any one aspect of a spaceship at a time, such as the shield or weapons. You can customize the way the parts of the ship work with gems you're able to earn through each stage. Mixing and matching the different gems to create wild new combinations keeps things fresh and creates a sense of exploration! 

The levels are split up into different stages, each with a different theme and gimmick. The difficulty of the levels ramps up nicely as you progress through the game, in a fair way that may push your teamwork to its limits at times. The graphics and soundtrack are cute but they pack a punch, with a consistent and well executed style. 

Playing this game by yourself is possible, but I would not recommend it, as the artificial intelligence system can be frusterating to work with. If you can get enough friends together, this is one of the funnest couch co-op games out there!

37530460.review: Lovers in a Dangerous Spacetime is a fun, clourful and very fun cooperative game. Don't be fooled by its asetetic though, theres so real challenge that comes from having to coordinate and comunicate with your crew and it's a blast. Great for couch co-op.

This is the kind of game that may look cutesy and harmless on the outside, but turns out to be rather ruthless and merciless on the inside... At least until you find enough friends to play with. Lovers in a Dangerous Spacetime is wonderfully made game, suitable for casual gamers. Though it can be a bit difficult at times (especially with the boss fights), with such adorable graphics, you never really lose your cool through it. Rather, the game provides a good laugh and an enjoyable time, even when someone screws up, though I supposed that depends more on what type of friendship you have with whom you are playing with.
Overall, it is a very pleasant experience and a great game to play with family or friends.

Es un juego de exploración y recoleccion de items cuyo objetivo es rescatar a los habitantes de esa galaxia secuestrados por robots malvados. 

Está muy orientado al juego en cooperativo local hasta 4 jugadores ya que cada uno se encargará de una de las funciones de la nave (Disparo, Mapa, Conducción, Escudos, disparo especial)

Habrá más de un modelo de nave y cada uno tendrá sus pros y contras. Se podrán mejorar los distintos elementos que forman la nave con gemas especiales.

+Es un genero divertido y cuenta con graficos alegres coloridos y desenfadados.

糖果色的画面，萌萌哒小动物，正能量的主题，零致敏元素，确保了它是一款真正的全年龄、全关系适用的合作类游戏。同时这也是对单人玩家最友好的合作游戏，系统提供的AI队友会在玩家的简单指令下前往指定炮台，并自动进行射击，且枪法非常精准，远远高于真人玩家的平均水准。游戏的难度可以随时切换，以适应不同程度的手残，更贴心的是，没有一个成就是和难度挂钩的。

四个大关，通关时长最笨不超过10小时，虽然每一张地图都是程序随机生成的，但是由于地形、敌人种类、玩法都不够丰满，重玩价值并不大。差不多正好在通关的时候，会产生“玩够了”的感觉。像心血来潮时买的一盒彩色积木，在一个晴朗的周末，坐在家里的地毯上兴致勃勃地玩一个下午，然后装回盒子，压在箱底，大概直到多年后，侄子第一次来拜访时才会再掏出来玩一次。

总评：8/10，每个人都应该有一盒彩色积木。

34723299.review:
Beautiful and non-gamer friendly co-op. Unlocks, upgrades and stretch goals keep it fun for replayablity.  Supports controller / keyboard combinations - managed to fit 3 people on one keyboard (had the bindings for the keypad rotated 90 degrees) so low commitment to peripherals if you have limited hardware or typically play with only 2 people. 

Plenty of homages to classic bullet hell shooters without being a strictly bullet hell game - homing missiles, explosive enemies, ramming enemies, mini-bosses which require using multiple stations (e.g. shield + gun) to defeat. 

Each level takes from 5-15 minutes so easy to throw in the rotation if hosting a night of local multiplayer games.

34685033.review:
"Mom, why is my cousin called Diamond?"

"Because your aunt loves diamonds, son."

"What about me?"

34677117.review:
I can't comment on the solo gamplay. but playing with 2 other friends was definitely a very enjoyable experience.

A surprisingly challenging game for the colorful graphic style, I found myself hoping between stations more then once during hard encounters and ennemies can overwhelm you quite easily if you're not careful. I can assure you, you will not get bored with this game.

PROS:

- Ship upgrades: throughout the levels, you can find 3 different types of gems (power, laser, metal) which modify the behaviors of your ships modules. Letting you customize your ship to match your playstyle, or the level you're playing on.

- Multiple Ships: once you get far enough more ships become available to you. some of them have a very different playstyle then the default ship.

- Bonus Objectives: to complet a level, you only need to gather 5 of the 10 friends that are trapped on the map. You must take the decision to risk your ship and save all your friends or take the safer route and go to the exit right away.

- Coop not optional: This game requires you to communicate and be on the same page as your teamates otherwise you won't get far.

CONS:

- No online Coop: A shame, but not that big of a con. Don't buy this game if you don't have any friends.

- Swaping module upgrades can be tricky: Later in the game you have the ability to have 2 upgrade slots on your modules. It happened to us more then once during our session that we want to swap out an upgrade but instead it will replace the upgrade you don't want to replace. Be very carful of where you're standing when swapping out a Gem.

Would You Recommend?

Yes, definitely buy this game if you have a couch and a couple friends to play with, It's tons of fun.

This is a great co-op game!  My son and I have been playing it for about 6 hours and are a little over half way through the game.  It's got the right mix of difficulty with fun. Music and graphics are fun.

If your looking for a co-op  game this is the game to buy.  So good!

33424981.review:
[spoiler][u]Se esse jogo não terminar com o seu relacionamento, seu parceiro é pra vida inteira[/u].[/spoiler]
Você logo vai notar que o amor, tema principal do jogo, deve ter preenchido seu coração durante a introdução, porque nada explicaria melhor você ainda não estar trocando socos com sua dupla. Diversão, risadas e irritação foi a trindade que se manifestou durante minha experiência com esse jogo. Ainda na campanha da "Ursa Maior", minha dupla disse, sempre delicada: "porque você não levanta sua bunda do controle do escudo e não atira na ala leste então?" Ah, o amor.
Nunca vi um jogo que merecesse tanto o termo de coop na minha biblioteca: se você e sua dupla não cooperarem, provavelmente vão se divertir por muito pouco tempo. Esse bullet hell (com um jeitinho de arcade survival) precisa de movimentos coordenados e uma equipe extremamente engajada, porque qualquer movimento desengonçado é punido severamente pelo jogo. 
__

O objetivo desse jogo é manter sua nave operante enquanto busca um número X de tripulantes-coelho que conseguem abrir o buraco de minhoca (ou um portão-coração gigante) para a outra fase. Há sempre o dobro da tripulação necessária para abrir o buraco em cada fase, e capturar mais tripulações do que o necessário te bonifica com cristais que te ajudam a aprimorar a nave. O jogo tem uma progressão bem planejada, e cabe a vocês dois utilizarem os cristais para aprimorar de forma eficiente sua nave. É um jogo frenético, e você normalmente vai perder de vista seu personagem por estar vendo a movimentações dos inimigos fora da sua nave. Belíssimo, roda a 60FPS tranquilamente (dependendo da máquina que estiver usando), e o jogo não apresenta qualquer queda de FPS, mesmo com sua beleza cósmica estonteante e uma tela repleta de inimigos atirando em sua nave-chiclete. A trilha sonora vai de música lofi à future house, todas muito bem escolhidas e que se encaixam muito bem no ambiente e no tempo do jogo. 
Tudo envolto em uma palheta de cores que causaria epilepsia no Japão dos anos 2000.

A proposta do jogo é nos levar a um gameplay coop local, então nada de suporte para o online (até agora, 10/07/17), mas a ultima atualização considerou aumentar o tamanho dos operantes, e agora o jogo tem suporte para até 4 jogadores.


De longe, um coop fantástico, recomendo fortemente a compra desse jogo caso tenha um companheiro de jogos. Caso não tenha, você pode arriscar e jogar com um animal de estimação (CPU) que te auxilia de forma bem menos eficaz nas operações da nave. Um bom teste de caráter para saber se pede ou não a mão da sua dupla em noivado, e uma ótima desculpa para acabar batendo no seu irmão mais novo.

33057907.review:
One of the best multiplayer games I have ever played. Best with four people, though.
This game is wonderful. Simple, yet will keep you and a few local friends very entertained. 
Playing this game by yourself is just not anywhere near as fun and is actually quite stressful. So try to only play when you have a few friends over and you have multiple controllers hooked up to your computer. If you meet those standards, prepare to have a great time. 
I can't say there is a lot of content in this game, but it's not expensive and when you can only play with friends, you probably won't beat this too fast. Also, by the time you beat the game, you will not be bored of it. I still really love this game after beating it and starting it again with another friend.
There's no bugs or problems that I have with it. Also, don't be turned away by the fruity aesthetic, it's great fun for anyone. It mixes silly light-heartedness with intense action very well.

32908573.review:
Muy buen juego, pero, se juega mejor con amigos.

Pros-
-Tiene una buena difilcultad, puedes cambiar entre difiicultades. (En Dificil a veces parece que estoy jugando Touhou)
-En Multiplayer se juega mejor.
-Jefes muy distintos el uno al el otro, ademas muy molestos en dificil.
-Las gemas le dan un buen toque de personalización.

Observaciones negativas-
-El singleplayer es muy frustrante por las razones de abajo (Me lo pase en singleplayer dificil...)
-La IA de la mascota espacial (Asistente semi-controlado que te dan si juegas solo) es muy torpe (Con el escudo), si la pones 
a usar el escudo no sabe que bloquear (Bloquea los pequeños disparos en vez de misiles y plasmas, quita el escudo cuando 
voy a estrellarme contra un enemigo, etc.), si la pones a usar las torretas... pues ahi si es buena (tiene una punteria del 
demonio y sabe fijar objetivos con prioridad) aun asi muchas veces 
perdi por la culpa de ese mapache... 
-Las combinaciones de gemas son amplias, pero despues de conocerlas todas, debo decir que algunas apestan y otras estan 
muy op... Mi build---> [spoiler]Chicle cero y Escudo Metal/Rayos, Torretas Rayos/Rayos, Propulsor Energia/Energia, Cañon Yamato Metal/Metal, Con este build podras matar lo que sea (Se necesita muy buena punteria y tener el escudo siempre en 
movimiento para que sea efectivo)[/spoiler]
-Las naves, esperaba que hubiera muchas naves con habilidades distintas, pero no fue asi, son pocas y poco originales. 
Abajo dejare como spoiler las naves que hay:

[spoiler]Chicle cero: La nave mas basica (y efectiva)[/spoiler]
[spoiler]Banana: 20% mas vida, pero se restringe el uso de los controles a cada jugador (Cada jugador solo podra controlar una parte de la nave)[/spoiler]
[spoiler]Jalea: Immune al daño de colisión (solo ambiente), tiene 3 torretas en lugar de 4, el propulsor es estatico (Cuando giras el propulsor tambien gira la nave, invirtiendo tus controles...)[/spoiler]
[spoiler]Chicle E: Chicle cero con una gema de energia en todas las ranuras.[/spoiler]
[spoiler]Chicle R: Como la de arriba pero con gemas de rayos.[/spoiler]
[spoiler]Chicle M: Igual pero con metal.[/spoiler]

Final: 8/10 Le falta duración, contenido y nerfs/buffs.

31718523.review:
This is the first game I ever played with my girlfriend. 

We moved in together, and I wanted her to pick up my hobby. I thought it'd be nice, and I always dreamed of having a gamer girlfriend. If she wasn't one, then I must simply convert her.

It was tough, and we've ran into many bad games trying to find our feet. Sure, you can google or youtube "best co op games to play with your significant other" but really, at the end of the day, it's trial and error. You just gotta buy, try, and see if it works. 

This game is not like that. This game, I bet you my house, will steal your girl. If you're trying to convert your girlfriend to video games, trust me, start with this game.

It's hard, but not so hard it'll frustrate a newb. It has perfect balance between co op and skill. What this means is that, both of you to some extent need to know what you're doing, and contribute to the task at hand (running away from the monsters, shooting the baddies, etc) but the more experienced gamer can still carry the team without making the others look useless. It's so much fun. You can calculate EVERY MOVE, but once it gets hectic, it's utter chaos. Incredibly good fun. 

97.5/100

PS follow "Convert Your Significant Other!" or CoYoSiOt, my Steam Curator page, if you're interested in finding good games with an emphasis on cooperative play and accessibility to convert your significant other! Does your loved one complain about your gaming habits? Says you spend too much time and money on steam? Worry not! Follow my page and I guarantee you'll both be spending twice as much time and money on gaming than ever before! Everybody wins! You win, your lover wins, and Steam wins!

31499655.review:
This might look like a silly and relaxing party game due to the cooperative nature. Don't be fooled! This world of love is hard to beat, and you and you're friend are going to really need to strategize and coordinate to win.

The game feels a lot like a bullet hell where all your controls have been made more awesome (but more complicated) by attaching them all to parts of a spaceship. You can play single player and have an ai partner that you can give directions to, but the game is designed for two player local coop. One person can control the engine, the map, the shield, or one of the four guns and at any one moment you will probably want to be using at least 3 of these things at once. However only two players can play at a time so you end up with these situations of "what can i stop using and still be alive" which i found really fun to try and explain to my sister who i played with. On top of that, the upgrade system to your ship starts off simple, but it has a lot to explore once you start collecting bunnies. The levels are really big, almost too big in my opinion but luckily a good chunk of every level is optional and you're free to explore it however you like. Highly recommend this game for you space exploring needs.

A technical note: full controller support is nice, but i found the keyboard default bindings to be really confusing and akward for two players. Luckily there are keybindings, but it feels weird that the game defaults to a state expecting a controller. Also slightly dissapointed we can't have a four man party but also i understand the limitations of this sort of game and appreciate it being as fun as it is.

31389008.review:
An amazing co-op experience. Over a few months I played through the whole campaign with my brother and we had a great time with it. It's such a seamless integration of a simple platformer game inside of a larger 2D space shooter. It predates Overcooked but shares a lot of the mayhem: what should be quite easy can easily become tense and thrilling due to a few miscommunicated intentions.

Some of the boss fights can be quite tedious, and having played it four-player a few times at the office I can definitely recommend only playing two-player. The third and fourth player generally sit on one or two turrets each and render the game quite easy and pedestrian. You gotta have a bit of panic to make the game memorable!

Plenty of replayability too, with unlockable ships that really mix up the interaction dynamic and mix'n'match upgrade options to explore.

Highly recommened if you want a bit more from your co-operative couch multiplayer.

31303183.review:
[h1]Great couch co-op, swinging spiked laser-balls at aliens has never been so fun![/h1]
This hit on a really good recipe of platform/shmup starship crewing, which could be even better if developers find time to add network play.

LOVERS is a true co-operative experience because you need your teammates taking care of different roles in order to succeed.

Playing with only two people is difficult as you must pick any two out of shooting/moving/deflecting projectiles at one time, which I guess adds a sort of challenge in prioritising and communicating, but in some situations that takes a huge toll on your survivability compared to if you have 3 or more players.

This seems to have great controller support too; I have been able to set up 4 players using even the complex combination of one Xbox360 controller, two PS2 dualshock 2 controllers plugged into a dual adapter, and one player on keyboard, and it works fine. That was testing on Linux though so YMMV.
For best results you should plug them in before starting, then assign controllers to players through the options menu.

The only negative thing I can say about it after a few hours of playtime is that you can't skip a quite lengthy intro cutscene when starting a new profile, which I found quite annoying, so please fix this.

I've only played DRM-free so far since getting it from the Humble store, hence the playtime, but just tested it on Steam and found that it detects existing save files from the same directory, which is also good.

N.B. the spiked laser balls are not balls made of lasers, but rather spikey flailing metal balls that shoot lasers out of them! SMASH SMASH PEWPEW!

[b]Fazit[/b]

Lovers in a Dangerous Spacetime ist ein raffiniertes Koop-Adventure, in dem man Rollen verteilt, da man ein Raumschiff mit vier Kanonen, einem Antrieb, Schutzschild, etc. steuert.
Wenn der Partner eher ballern möchte, kann er an die Kanonen; wer das beste Feingefühl hat, sollte an den Antrieb. 

Die Levels sind manchmal sehr eng und die Bedrohung lauert von mehreren Seiten, daher ist Absprache Pflicht. Und das funktioniert wunderbar, alle Stationen sind bequem ereichbar. Ein wunderbarer Shared Screen-Spaß, auch wenn die Story und Grafik ein bisschen zu "süß" gehalten ist. Aber das ist im Endeffekt Geschmackssache.

31125398.review:
[u][b]Positives:[/b][/u]
+Unique game concept with Local Co-Op for up to 4 players (game controllers make this a lot easier)
+Gameplay that's challenging enough to remain interesting and encourage teamwork
+Compelling ship upgrade system that makes it really exciting to find new treasure

[u][b]Negatives:[/b][/u]
-Some ship upgrades are noticeably less useful or fun than others, fortunately you can redistribute some ship upgrades as you go
-The ship's mapping/navigation system feels clunky. If one player wants to look at the map it pauses the action for the whole team

[u][b]Overall:[/b][/u]
Lovers in a Dangerous Spacetime is a top-tier choice if you're looking for something to play during an extended hangout with friends or family. It has a simple premise to draw players in, but enough depth to really feel rewarding.

31051204.review:
Summary: A TRUE co-operative experience that's rarely seen. Like another great example, "Overcooked", this game has perfectly captured the essence of co-operative play, and player co-ordination through strong communication. Unlike most "co-op" games, trying to go it alone, or trying to "be the best guy" doesn't fly here. You'll work together, running around a ship, controlling turrets, shields, lasers, and guiding the ship through hazardous space. It's a LOT of fun, and I would say a must buy for local couch co-op. 

Pros:
+ Designed around co-operative play
+ Co-op Campaign
+ The "lone wolf" mentality is rightly the worst choice, as should be the case in a good co-op experience (see Overcooked as another great example of this)
+ Quick to learn
+ Encourages participation from gamers of a variety of skill levels
+ Encourages strong communication between players
+ The screen is tidy, and everything sized just right to lend to visual clarity
+ Up to 4 players can play at once
+ Couch co-op, Steam link works great, and has great controller support

Cons:
- Not much... the players who like to be "winning" will be sadly disappointed, but that makes me VERY happy
- Online co-op not supported (I prefer couch co-op, but I ca see this being a drawback for some)

30091649.review:
It's hard to imagine how this game got such a positive review considering it's so poorly designed for the PC. But first things first, quick buyers' guide. This game is intended for players with multiple controller and multiple gamer friend. To have the optimal experience you need 3 other player and a total of 4 game controller. Be warned, your frustration will increase the further you are from the ideal setup.

Breakdown:

Graphics: 2D doesn't mean it can't have any depth. I've seen 2D games like "the way" having beautifully drawn, detailed background that far surpass the graphics in this game. While the graphics in this game is acceptable, it only passes by the mediocre standard of the average fastfood industry mindset of our average consumer.

soundtrack: Again, just enough to fill the silence but probably not gonna put it in my playlist anytime soon. On the other hand, the taste in music quite often differs from person from person so I'll leave it at that.

game mechanics: Heres where I felt the game failed the most. First off, the game is intended to be played with a controller, which is not part of an average PC setup. On top of that, this game only have local multiplayer. To further add to the problem, on single player mode you start with only one AI partner, which does a mediocre job at assisting you. As a result, you constantly have to sprint from station to station (like between the ship control to gun control) and to put a cherry on the top enemy also spawn continuously. If this game gives you more AI partner, or allows you to move and fire at the same time in single player or spawn well less enemy or allows the player to scroll out to see a bigger area or do just about anything else. Then this game wouldn't be as bad as it is. But the sad reality is, this game is intended for console, this game is intended for multiplayer. And then the developers throw in a single player mode as an after thought. Which of course failed miserably.

In summary, based on the frustrating game mechanics and average graphics and soundtrack. I'm scoring this game 6/10. On the other hand, if you happend to have a lot of gamer friends handy then I'd highly recommend this game.

29928794.review:
This game is one of the best hidden gems on steam. It's a game about flying a spaceship and rescuing space critters, with every player manning a different station. For example, someone might be stearing, while another is on shields, and another on a turret. It's such a cool concept, and it's executed phenomenally well. Switching between stations is fast and easy, and all of the controls are simple and intuitive.

 The three difficulties encompass pretty much every playstyle there is; with easy being almost impossible to die in, normal being challenging but fair, and hard/veteran being hard enough that you're almost guaranteed to die a few times. 

The music in this game is incredible. This game would have been perfectly fine if there was some generic, relaxing "space" music in the background, but they decided to do more than that. Some of the tracks are reminiscent of Hotline Miami. Almost kind of odd considering how cutsy this game is, but it works and sounds great (look up "ost Crystal C"). And the boss themes are intense and get the heart pounding (my favourite is "Orion"). 

The graphics are beautiful to look at and everything animates extremely smooth. It can be eye candy in some parts. I should also mention that while this game is meant to be played with a friend or significant other, it's still fun to play the game by yourself. If played solo, you get an npc that you can tell to man different stations. The AI is good enough that you never get frustrated with it; it's honestly better than most real people I've played this with. 

In conclusion, this game is well worth the $15 asking price, and a steal when it goes on sale. So do yourself a favor and pick this up. You won't regret it! (probably)

29927045.review:
Lovin' it !!

I enjoyed my first try as a single-player but then I thought it would maybe be better to experience the game with some friend. I had a Couch Co-op session with a buddy yesterday and it was amazing, we failed a few times but it was hours of crazy fun. 

Considering I only have about 4-5 hours in..
The Music is entertaining and varies on each level so far.
The Action is well paced and it's really fun to split up responsibilities thru team-work.
I do think the game is better thru a Co-op experience, kinda sad there's no online experience but a mic would be essential at that point to be on par with local co-op, it does require coordination.
The Game offers a good replay value with the different upgrade combinations you can apply to your ship, different configs bring different play-styles and I love the originality of that mechanic.

It has a Millenium Falcon feel, a Chewy and Han Solo duo working together thru their adventure.

If you enjoy Couch Co-op games, like light techno music and the kind of art-style you see here.. this is a MUST for you !! If you can catch this on sale it's a no-brainer for me.. totally recommended.

非常无比的欢乐。

跟我弟弟妹妹一起过年玩通关了。虽然是简单难度。。妹妹的游戏天赋简直是负数。。跟本宝宝一起在打猎户座
boss的时候都要气炸啦！！


先说说优点：

1.关卡设计很棒。每个新的大关都有新的怪物和机关，水球啊，暗流，自爆机关啥的。

2.飞船的设计很棒。根据解救人数提升等级解锁各种各样的飞船。每个飞船每个炮台都可以用两个宝石强化，三种宝石可以组合出不同炮台，这点还是很有意思的。
哦，推进器和防护罩也可以分别两种强化。还有大招！

3.美术很有自己风格。整体看起来非常可爱舒服。博士和每个玩家操作的角色的过场动画，动作，都很搞，爱的主题设定也很逗。

再来说说缺点：

1.绝对不要自己玩后面的关卡= -，绝对不要，简直是在找虐，玩了一个小时不到就有强烈的孤寂的感觉（真的完全不够用）。
PC给你的狗狗不能控制飞船，那么只能你自己开飞船了。
后期防护罩又是很重要的控制台，狗狗去控制了又没人打怪。

你要么忍着打让狗狗清理，自己开飞船走位；要么自己原地不动，自己去清理怪物，打完再走（这真的很烦，我相信没有一个玩家自己玩的时候只想开飞船不用自己升级的各色炮台打怪的）；要么就是一直跑路，狗狗防御。

如果你自己单打猎户座boss，我相你会气炸，我打的还是简单模式的。

我觉得单人模式PC再加个猫咪AI用还差不多。


最后说句：如果有人一起玩，买吧，超级欢乐 :)  !!!

29060124.review:
Obtuve este producto por pura casualidad a través de un [i]bundle[/i], y es el clásico juego que le pasa a uno totalmente desapercibido y considera mero relleno que sólo servirá para aumentar el tamaño de la [i]pile of shame[/i]. Tras haberlo completado al 100% con mi hermano os puedo decir que es el juego cooperativo que más he disfrutado en muchísimo tiempo.

Sus virtudes:

[list]
[*][b]Duración adecuada:[/b] Completarlo al 100% nos ha llevado casi 9h.
[*][b]Es variado:[/b] Aunque tiene una mecánica básica conductora predominante, introduce constantemente pequeños elementos que aportan variedad a la jugabilidad.
[*][b]Accesible e intuitivo:[/b] Es coger el mando y ponerse a jugar. Sin complicaciones para nadie.
[*][b]Dificultad bien ajustada:[/b] No resulta frustrante en ningún momento, y jugadores más [i]hardcore[/i] podrán compartir sesión con otros más [i]casual[/i]. Sin embargo conseguir rescatar a todos los amigos supone un pequeño desafío muy gratificante.
[*][b]Es un cooperativo [i]real[/i]:[/b] Sin artimañas. Nada de incluir elementos que sólo puede manejar un personaje para justificar el aspecto multijugador de la campaña. Simplemente [i]hacen falta[/i] varios jugadores bien coordinados para manejar los diferentes subsistemas de la nave y hacer frente a las ordas de enemigos con garantías.
[*][b]Es muy bonito:[/b] Entra por los ojos. El aspecto neón colorista, los efectos y partículas... todo resulta agradable y vistoso.
[*][b]Rebosante de mimo y detallismo:[/b] No sólo se trata del aspecto visual. Los controles, los escenarios, los personajes... se nota el cariño depositado en cada detalle para convertirlo en una experiencia satisfactoria.
[*][b]No es [i]empalagoso[/i] en absoluto:[/b] Por el título o la estética pudiera parecerlo, pero se trata más de un recurso humorístico. Basta citar una frase de nuestro mentor en el juego, el Dr. Peluchín: [i]"Confiad en el poder del amor... y de las armas mejoradas."[/i].
[/list]

En definitiva, si tienes al menos dos mandos y alguien con quien jugarlo sentados en el sofá o equivalente, cógelo. Sin reservas. ¡Os va a gustar seguro!

28990096.review:
Vous avez une LAN de prévue et vous voulez apporter une touche de fraîcheur dans vos jeux habituels de LAN ?
-Prise en main simple comme bonjour
-Jouable de 2 à 4
-Une multitude de raisons pour critiquer vos amis
-Bosses fight réglo avec une bonne organisation 

Votre esprit d'équipe sera mis à rude épreuve dans ce jeu mélangeant intelligemment votre dextérité et organisation de groupe en mettant à votre disposition gestion  differents modules :
-Modules de tirs
-Moteur
-Bouclier
-YAMATO CANON
-Carte

Ce jeu à la bonne idée de nous mettre dans une situation où progresser seul est impossible et où chaque personne est nécessaire et utile dans l'équipage, tous les modules mis à disposition trouvent forcément leur utilitée et chaque joueur se plait à les tester les uns après les autre. Et c'est sans compter sur le fait que des gemmes apportant des changements aux modules qu'on l'on s'empresse de vouloir découvrir.

Mon expérience de jeu(Pour le nouvel an):

Ayant mis le jeu sur ordinateur portable puis branché à la télé du salon, je branche deux manettes et joue avec un ami, 5 minutes plus tard c'est pas moins de 4 manettes et les 12 personnes présentes ce jour là qui se trouvaient devant l'écran affalé sur le canapé et les fauteuils environant à se passer la manette afin de sauver l'espace !!

C'est au milieu des fous rires, des insultes et des cris de joie que mes amis ont découvert LOVERS in a dangerous spacetime et qui malgré sa campagne rapidement terminée(1h 30) à su nous faire passer un moment aussi intense qu'amusant.

En Bref:
-Une LAN en vue ?
-Vous voulez tester la puissance de votre amitiée ?
-Vous êtes DRH ?
-Une simple soirée entre potes pas prise de tête ?

Si vous cumulez 2 oui alors vous devrez passer un bon moment sur le jeu avec vos amis.
Si vous en avez 3 et que vous n'êtes pas DRH vous êtes un ami exeptionnel de penser et de faire plaisir à vos amis comme ça, votre soirée n'en sera que plus épique. Prennez vous de bonnes pizzas, quelques boissons choisissez bien vos coéquipiers et vous voilà partis dans nuage rose en forme de coeur pour sauver l'amour entre les galaxies !

28747709.review:
A fantastically polished game.

The mechanics in this game are fasinating, and in the hands of a lesser developer, small problems (like handling ladders) could ruin everything. But they pulled it off! 

Gameplay pretty frantic and requires good team play. Anytime things go badly, you only have yourself and not the controls to blame. 

Dual controllers are supported and work perfectly, but you'll need to get use to how aiming works which in the heat of battle _can_ become disorientating. But stick with it because it makes sense in the end.

Levels are even a little random so replays are not a chore.

The 2D vector graphics are beautiful and smoothly animated. And best of all, they're not montonusly neon like some games that try and do the same style.

No bugs or glitchyness at all!

This is seriously one of the best local co-op games I've ever played (yes, even next to Metal Slug).

這是一款單機合作遊戲，不支援連線，最多可以4個人一起玩，本作共有4大關，每大關有5小關，每次遊玩都會隨機生成地圖，若是單人遊玩會很貼心的給你一隻可以幫你操控的小寵物，不過先說好，牠並不會開船喔。

遊戲的目的是要救出被困在各個星系的森林小伙伴，你必須與你的朋友合力操控一艘太空船來擊敗宇宙怪物或是躲避危險。

玩家最多4人，但可操控的位置達到8個之多，換言之，需要看情況來變換位置來應付各種狀況，但~~~~~~~天有不測風雲，人總有旦夕禍福，有時候會發生以下狀況

28265231.review: I love this game.  My wife, who's normally not great at video games, even enjoys playing it.  It's playable solo, but I've found that it's most fun with 3 or 4 players.

28255420.review: Rapidement essayé a deux, très amusant et exigeant (en difficile). Idéal multi local (couch coop).

28227010.review:
И ещё один симпатичный олдскульный аркадный экшен. Вселенная страдает от вторжения Вселенского Зла, которое разрушило Машину Любви, и теперь галактика распадается. Наш герой, последний уцелевший страж на последнем уцелевшем корабле, отправляется на поиски потерянных запчастей...

Стилистика игры намеренно несерьёзная. Герои - зайчики, енотики, собачки, антигерои - абстрактные роботы, мушки и космические корабли. Геймплей довольно простой, хоть и своеобразный: у корабля есть четыре пушки со всех сторон (он круглый, и летит в любую сторону), и врагов можно расстреливать, только если они с "правильной" стороны. Задачи просты и понятны, карта чистая, играй, да радуйся. Чтобы не заскучать, механика постепенно усложняется - к "простым" врагам добавляются "мобильные", планеты получают гравитацию, кое-где всплывают ловушки и специальные зоны... это интересно, на самом деле.

Но тут возникает парочка нюансов.

1. Игра заточена под кооператив. Нет, есть однопользовательский режим, когда главный герой мечется по кораблю, а его помощник-зверёк управляет тем оборудованием, что ему дадут. Проблема в том, что необходимых точек - шесть (4 пушки, двигатель и генератор защиты), и двух персонажей на них банально мало. Нет, если идти в темпе черепахи, то пройти можно и так. Просто это будет очень и очень долго (я за семь часов прошёл две зоны первой кампании. Две самых простых зоны, разумеется).

2. Враги респаунятся, и очень интенсивно. Грубо говоря, полёт на 3-5 длин корабля инициирует респаун - и враги больше не отстают. Я так поторопился и завалил вторую зону, попытавшись оторваться от парочки врагов. В итоге погиб в неравном бою с дюжиной противников со всех сторон. То есть, единственно правильный геймплей - отстреливать всех по мере появления. И тут мы упираемся в п.1 - рук не хватает. Или ты стоишь на месте и отстреливаешься - или ты летишь, но тогда некому стрелять! Это затягивает игру ещё больше.

Так что я помучился-помучился (потому что игра-то хороша!) и стёр. Рекомендую - но только для кооператива.

Lovers in a Dangerous Spacetime ist eine genialer Koopspaß für einen längeren Spieleabend. Wie in FTL müssen die einzelnen Geschütze, Schilde oder Antriebe bedient werden, um die Gegnerhorden zu besiegen. Im Unterschied zu FTL bedient man diese aber aktiv.

Gerade im Koopmodus erfordert dies einen nicht unerheblichen Abstimmungsaufwand, was dieses Spiel aber auch wieder hervorragend kommunikativ macht.

Pro Level-abschnitt muss man eine bestimmte Anzahl gleichgesinnter und Upgrades finden. Da das Level gefühlt aber mit der Zeit immer schwerer wird, muss man gut abwägen, wie gierig man sein will. Das Spiel an sich ist ordentlich fordernd, weshalb wir uns über den leichten Schwierigkeitsgrad gefreut haben.

Ich kann mir gut vorstellen dieses Spiel in einer anderen Konstellation noch einmal zu spielen.

4/5

26666972.review:
通关撒花：危险时空的恋人，一款合作横版射击游戏，最多支持4人进行合作，如果有舍友之类的小伙伴一起玩会是不错的选择。

特别提醒：本作没有网络联机，只有本地合作，在单人进行游戏的情况下，可携带一只宠物一起战斗，但配合就不能要求太高了。

游戏共4大关，每大关下有5小关，玩家的任务是与“反爱组织”作战，回收4个爱心反应堆，让宇宙重新充满爱。每大关结束的时候进行BOSS战，开始新一大关的时候可以给飞船升级。升级解锁的某些飞船存在一定的缺陷，在8级之前推荐使用默认飞船。

飞船升级的条件是解救足够数量的小动物，每小关里都有10个小动物等待拯救，找到5个即可解锁出口，但玩家可以选择继续探索地图。飞船功能有：4架普通炮和一架高能炮、驾驶台、地图、防御罩，2个玩家操作还是有些手忙脚乱的，小伙伴多多益善。

飞船的驾驶需要动力推进，因此实际前进的方向和玩家操纵的方向是相反的，这一点要注意。地图上的问号常常是属性宝石的所在地，玩家收集宝石给飞船上的武器、动力和防御升级，宝石的不同组合往往有意想不到的效果。

游戏非常需要配合：开炮的时机、防御的时机、逃跑的时机等等，都需要小伙伴之间倾力合作。5门炮的攻击范围彼此错开，因此炮手常常需要跑上跑下。在敌人发起大规模袭击的时候，驾驶员更是要在战与逃之间做出抉择，不能只顾着开飞船。

本作很好的融合了战斗与合作、收集与成长等要素，没有网络联机功能是个遗憾，但即使是现在，它也是一款非常优秀的游戏了。

Designated shield operator here.

I've played a number of casual party games and this one stands far above others. Pulsing EDM soundtrack + cute cartoon action + engaging upgrade tree for your ship. Much better as a 3-4 player game than 2-player.

With two people, you're forced to park the spacecraft before you can clear the area of enemies. The shield operator spends a lot of their time just watching for incoming projectiles or waiting at their desk for something to happen.

Controllers do make the game easier, since you're not limited to traveling in the eight basic directions. Since it's local co-op only, you might check your PC to make sure you have enough USB ports.

This game is exactly what I look for in a 2-4 person couch co-op. My friends and I started playing at around 2pm yesterday and played for 7 hours straight until we beat it, we were having such a blast. The art is adorable and the gameplay hits the nail on the head. The controls are so simple that your one-joystick-at-a-time friends can play easily. The game plays exactly how it should. No weird bugs, glitches, or missing/improper gameplay mechanics to be found. This is especially true in terms of the upgrade system. Upgrading different parts of your ship is awesome! Every single time my friends and I installed a new upgrade or new upgrade combo and then tested it for the first time, all of our reactions were "OOOOOHHHHH!!!!!" in sync. We had a blast exploring different combinations of upgrades for each station. The maps are also all uniquely generated which makes trying levels again just as challenging as the first time.

Honestly, this game knocks it out of the park. I cannot recommend it enough to people looking for a great couch co-op experience.

25085721.review:
If like me, you've always wanted a game where you and a few friends are the crew of a starship on a harrowing adventure, then this just might be the game for you. In a nutshell, Lovers is a space action game where 1-4 players share the task of running a small spaceship. Your tiny characters run and jump from room to room to man weapon turrets, direct shields, activate special weapons and pilot your space jalopy. If you've played FTL, that will give you a rough idea of how the ship is layed out. As you thrust around the 2D enviorments dodging space rocks and blasting a menagerie of baddies your main goal is to rescue imprisoned space bunnies who annoyingly scream when you get near them. Once you've located and freed enough of them the exit will open and you can blast your way to the next level. 

It's a simple formula that stays fresh for a few reasons: Firstly, each module on your ship can be augmented with a gem that changes it's function. For instance a metal gem, turns your gun turret into a tethered spike ball that you launch at enemies and retract. A beam gem placed in your shield generator allows you to deflect enemy projectiles back at them, etc. With upgrades you can add 2 gems to each module for even more varied abilities. Secondly, the enviorments in each level provide just enough in new obstacles to keep from getting stale. A water level might have a rushing current that carries you around a level while sinister pods sticking to the walls will burst unleashing a group of small enemies upon you if you get to close. Lastly, the games core gameplay co-op spaceship action, is simple, fun, frantic and challenging enough that it will keep you and your friends engaged for a long time.

On the minus side, playing with 3-4 people is the ideal number and any less can become frustrating as you will constantly need to run all over your ship. With only 1 or 2 people this means one of your important ship systems will be unmanned, leaving you vulnerable in one way or another in dire situations. For instance, there are several cases where enemies will frantically swarm you and the best course of action is to jet away while your buddies shield to fend them off and blast a trail for you with a weapon turret. With out the manpower to cover all your systems it can be very difficult to survive in these situations. In single player you are given a competent AI partner and you have the option of lowering the difficulty, but the problem still persists. And to compound this problem is the glaring omission of online play. While playing Lovers with a room of friends is a great experience that we don't get enough of these days, the convenience of online play should not have been ignored and would still provide a great co-op experience.

Despite these issues. Lovers manages to provide a unique, charming and visually striking space adventure like no other. As a single player experience it's still an enjoyable game. However, if you have the means to play with 3-4 people, this is when Lovers really shines.

8.5/10

25067538.review:
I've played this once before 2p with another person, and even though I'd prefer it this way, the 1p mode was very well done.  Some very minor quirks with how the AI pet does stuff, but it makes up for that in other ways, like being more competent.

Multple types of spaceships, ship feature combinations, variety in level environments (e.g. rocky zone/forests, water, ice, and mech zone), variety of levels (e.g. fight waves of enemies, timed mode, and boss battles in addition to the "find 2 lovers and complete the level")

24990746.review:
[h1]A Co-Op Action Space Shooter[/h1]
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rDC56KBbgSQ
+ Very unique gameplay that is surprisingly fun. You have a sphere spacehsip which has a number of different modules including turrets, shields, driving, and so fourth. You can only command 1 of these modules at a time, so you quickly have to move between each one in order to defend different sides of the ship.
+ Visually the game looks great with bright neon colors and very clean yet detailed graphics. The particle effects, bullets, and so fourth also look fantastic.
+ Cute lovable story about Love and Anti-Love with very cute animal characters and lots of hearts.
+ Many weapon combinations created through "gems" which you can combine to create new and creative weapons.
+ The boss fights are pretty epic in scale, are a load of fun, and can be quite challenging at times
+ 1-4 Co-Op, if you have 4 players to play this game with you, you will have an absolute BLAST although the game is perfectly playable solo as you are given an AI companion.
+ Amazing soundtrack

- Your AI companion can be a little "dumb" at times. I often found that it had a difficult time commanding the shields especially when there was two enemies on the screen.
- No online multiplayer... The gameplay itself can be a bit frustrating and overwhelming at times if playing solo especially when being attacked from multiple different sides at once. I think the best way to play is with 3-4 players, however this is tough to do on PC.

24819984.review:
Since I will be living away from my brother for some time, I decided to take up on the game and offer him the chance to finish a co-op playthrough. It would be nice to play some local co-op games before I leave, and Lovers in a Dangerous Spacetime had given us a enjoyable experience.

The first time we launched the game it was from my brother's Steam account, so we stopped halfway through the first cutscene to change to my account, which owns the game, just so I can get some trading cards and achievements.

Both times we watched to first cutscene, my bother would always tell me that I'm gay. Maybe because it's called "Lovers" in a Dangerous Spacetime, but I had figured it was fine to play with my brother. 

The first boss we came across taught us that the game would be a ton more challenging that it seeemed. We had died an enless amount of times to that boss, because we lacked coordination. My brother, a true lover of the Souls franchise (I am one too), complained that the bosses were way too hard, and "I'd rather finish our Kirito and Asuna builds in Dark Souls 2." But I convinced him to keep trying, well, more like I forced him to.

By the time we defeated the second boss, which was suprisingly easy, our coordination had improved signifigantly. We would man the turrents, the shields, and drive at the same time. Still, we often found ourselves rushing to the love portal at the end of the level with the tiniest skimp of health.

In summary, the game has you and your friends working together in different roles to defeat the antilove monsters, and though this shared experience will reinforce relationships as well as build new ones. Of course, it is frustratingly dificult, but that just means you and your friends will feel more acomplished when you win. Don't be fooled by the title of the game, play it with your guy friends or gal friends. Heck, why not all of your friends in 4-player co-op? (assuming you only have four friends, which I totally feel ya). Very fun and frustrating local co-op. 8.5/10

Oh, and by the way, we did play this on two player co-op normal mode.

"Just restart the level until we get the last metal gem we need to wreck the boss with our rocket launchers! They do soooo much damage OPOP."

24467678.review:
I've seen a preview of this game years ago. When I found out it's finally coming out I couldn't wait. I bought it on release without thinking.
Oh man, did this game DELIVER.
I love coop games and this is pretty much the pinnacle of what I've seen. It is currently my No. 1 favourite coop game of all time. It dethroned Lara Croft and the Guardian of Light and that's quite an achivement in my book.
Most games have tacked-on coop modes that many times just don't work. This a true coop experience and everything is built around it. You can play solo but it's rather boring since you'll be flying the ship 90% of the time while an AI partner will do most of the more interesting stuff (like shooting !). I also didn't play 3 or 4-player coop so I can't tell how good that is. The core 2 player experience is insane though.
The game is so action packed you'll forget you had real-life stuff to do. Every level is a constant scramble to man the necessary stations. It's almost like there's not enough people on your ship, but that's what makes it so fun to pull off. You need to fly the ship, angle the shields and shoot 4 guns all at the same time and enemies just keep on coming.
There's a surprising amount of variation on subsystem upgrades (guns, shields etc.) and you can tweak your ship to fit your playstyle.
Levels are semi-randomized. You get the same opponents and similar obstacles but the layout changes. It's not the level of some other games but enough to keep the levels from becoming a chore to repeat if you fail.
Each campaing has a different theme and ends in a pretty cool and challenging boss fight. Each level also has a different twist on the theme.
There's 3 different ships (2 unlock later) plus the one you start with gets a few upgrated versions later on. One of the other ships is kind of weird and not everybody will be able to play it though. I don't wanna spoil here but is a little mind bending. Makes some people dizzy. I'd kind of like some more ships but it's not that big of a deal.

It is local coop only and many people complain about it. It's understandable and a valid point but I would like to add that I feel like this game would not be that fun if you weren't sitting next to your partner. Online coop is great - but it's not the same.
So if you have somebody to play with I'd HIGHLY RECOMMEND buying this. Worth every penny.

24446096.review:
Super super fun local co-op game. You and a friend (you can do up to four people but it was mainly designed for two) are supposed to pilot a spaceship across various levels and fight various bosses, while each manning one of six or seven different vital operations in the ship. An enemy comes out of nowhere towards you from the left, do you have one person jump on the piloting seat to fly away while the other person fires a weapon? What about the shields? If you have one person on shields while another person fires, you're not going anywhere and can get ambushed! If you have one person on shields and the other person pilots the ship away, you're not doing damage and risk more enemies following you!

It's managing chaos, so for some people that might be a blast, and for others it might not seem fun at all. I personally think its a blast, as long as you go in with a lighthearted attitude and don't take it too seriously. Games are supposed to be fun, not ruin friendships. Enjoy this crazy co-op adventure!

24150451.review:
If you're looking for a unique local co-op experience, Lovers in a Dangerous Spacetime may be what you're looking for:

With up to three friends (or alone with a remote controlled pet) you have to control the ship using multiple stations. The ship always has multiple weapon stations, an engine station, a shield station and one station for the Yamato cannon. Each station can be further enhanced with gems found during a run, which can change the way the station works entirely, adding to the experience.

The key lies within coordinating who uses which station at which time and which upgrades to put where, in order to safely travel through the universe, defeat enemies and rescue your "friends".

You can expect about 6-10h of pure co-op fun for one playthrough.

23745237.review:
Platforming within a tiny area, difficult multi-tasking fun. Brutally lovely and dangerously satisfying! We don't get awesome co-op games like this one that often.

The goal of every stage is to collect space bunnies.

Only con this game has is that it lacks any kind of option for online multiplayer. (Okay, maybe another con is that, being an indie game made with Unity and all, it may not be appealing to AAA weeaboos who play games for nothing more than realistic graphics and Japanese anime fanservice.) 

Despite its aesthetics, this is not a casual game. Not the most brutal game by any means, but its difficulty might still turn some people off, unless, played with friends.

While I think it's foolish not to implement online features in a multiplayer-centric game (if it's within the capabilities of the devs), I do understand the sheer difficulty of just doing anything online and multiplayer. So, don't really care if it doesn't have online co-op!

23062670.review:
En un espacio laberíntico, te toca salir a cazar conejos dentro de una nave circular con un arma en cada punto cardinal, un motor propulsor, un escudo, una "superarma" y un mapa. Pero no estás solo: te acompaña tu fiel mascota o un máximo de 3 amigos humanos. Alguien al timón, otro al escudo, otro a un arma... ¡pero bueno, nos falta gente! No te preocupes, que ya suelto yo los mandos de la nave y agarro la repetidora.

Este es un juego cooperativo en el más puro sentido de la palabra: o te pones de acuerdo con tu compi, o te explotarán la nave; y sí, puedes jugar tú solo con la IA, pero no lo vas a disfrutar igual.

PROS:

+ Mecánica, estilo y jugabilidad únicos; yo no había visto nada por el estilo. Y parecía que ya estaba todo inventado...
+ Hasta 4 jugadores a la vez.
+ Muy divertido.
+ Diversos mundos con jefes finales, varias naves y personajes desbloqueables, distintas armas según combines las gemas, etc.
+ A tu chica probablemente le gustará.

CONTRAS:

- Se te hará repetitivo al cabo de un rato si no descansas entre partida y partida. 
- Poca variedad de enemigos. 
- Pocos niveles.
- Que no tenga cooperativo "online" (sólo local).

Aunque tiene cierta progresión, no deja de ser un (buen) juego casual. Además, que tu novia juegue contigo, no tiene precio: una partida y luego un casquete.

My girlfriend and I are always on the hunt for good co-op games. They are so few and far between that I actually created 2 gaming stations 90 degrees off each other each with its own console and projector so we could play "online" together in the same room. Lovers in a Dangerous Spacetime was a fantastic antidote to that solution. When you want to play co-op nothing beats being on the same (non-split) screen. This had that. The gameplay is really fun. Challenging not only in terms of enemies, but also the mechanics of play (really cleverly twisted as you go) and the gem combo system is really fun and allows the player to really feel out how they best want to interact with the game. Cannot recommend this game enough!

Oh and it's SUPER cute too!

22958296.review:
Bin so begeistert von dem Game, dass ich schnell ein Review schreibe, bevor der Daily Deal morgen vorbei ist. Für Couch Party Fans ist es eines der wenigen Games auf Steam, die man kooperativ spielt und ein Muss! Doch worum geht's? Bis zu vier Spieler steuern kooperativ ein Raumschiff, dabei übernimmt jeder ein Subsystem - z.B. Steuerung, Schilde oder eines der Waffensysteme. Habe es gestern auf der SteamMachine mit einem Freund gezockt, wo es problemlos unter SteamOS lief. Heute nochmal die erste Mission im Single Player gespielt unter Windows. Spielt man allein, bekommt man ein Pet, dass der Computer übernimmt. Diesem kann man dann ein System zuweisen. Aber allein würde ich es nicht empfehlen - so richtig bocken tut es mit mehreren auf der Couch! Ohne zu wissen, wie umfangreich es wirklich ist, vermute ich langen Spielspaß, denn man kann noch einige Raumschiffe freischalten und die Systeme derer auch noch upgraden. Klare Kaufempfehlung! :)

Wer jetzt Lust bekommen hat auf Local Coop Games, dem empfehle ich meine Couch Party Gruppe:
http://steamcommunity.com/groups/couchparty

22957383.review:
An absolute joy to play! 

LiaDS is a fantasticly intuitive and engaging take on the "Local Multiplayer," game genre. So much, that the game is infinitely more rewarding with more friends to play. By that token, buys beware: it is highly recommended you bring additional passengers for this ride!

Great presentation and audio make this an endearing package, with gameplay that is simple to understand, but hard to master as the levels progress. It is evident that an enormous amount of effort was invested into LiaDS, a sediment which is echoed by excellent aethestics, difficulty progression, and engaging gameplay.

A few gripes do not escape this game from a hearty recommendation. Gamers who are wishing for a forgiving game will be marginally dissapointed, as after a couple hours of gameplay, the level of challenge ramps up significantly. Game levels become long, and trecherous. A misfired cannon, or an unmanned engine can potentionally lead to demise; a loss of 20-30 minutes of gameplay to restart the level.

By inverse, the game is rewarding. If you can progress in the game with enough skill and determination, you are rewarded with more gadgets and enemys to test the might of your friends and yourself. 

If you are interested in a well-constructed, engaging, and fun local multiplayer game, look no further. Lovers in a Dangerous Spacetime is a voyage your friends will be begging you to embark on again, and again!

22930907.review:
Странно, что почти нет отзывов на Русском...
Ну что ж, пока тут скидка, поделюсь своим мнением.

Первое, что вам нужно знать — это игра про игру в несколько человек, кооперацию и вообще веселье на одном диване.. Играть с компом можно, конечно, но куда как более уныло(Хотя я и не пробовал даже, честно говоря, но основное веселье идет именно от кооперации)

Так вот, управляем мы, значит, большой космической хреновиной, спасая космозаек и неся любовь галактике, т.к. кто-то нехороший захотел ее скоммуниздить. Управление происходит посредством беганья от одного пульта управления к другому, каждый из которых отвечает за определенную часть коробя, как то: управление, пушки, защита и т.п.
Каждый элемент можно прокачивать, вставляя кристаллы улучшения и комбинируя между друг другом, что привносит разнообразия в управление и гейплей, и благодаря чему можно бегать туда-сюда в раздумьях о том, куда же лучше вставить кристалл и какой эффект это даст.

Сам геймплей разделен по картам, целью которых является некое стандартное задание вроде спасения n космозаек или убийства большого босса, а между уровнями можно полечиться и прокачать корабль. Интересно было бы посмотреть в такой игре на открытый мир, но увы.

Еще классная графика и музон, но это и по видео понятно)

Вообще, советую однозначно, если ищите во что погонять с вдвоем.
Но все же отмечу пару минусов:
1. "Нефизичное" поведение корабля в космосе - как будто по земле движется, на самом деле, почти сразу тормозит и не разгоняется выше определенного предела. Но с другой стороны это все же аркада, так что такая вещь вполне ожидаемо опущена, да и девушке, например, было в плюс, что не надо заморачиваться
2. Как я писал выше - карты хоть и большие, но все же разграничены. Наверное, просто мне не хватает каких-то rpg элементов

22730701.review:
Completed this game with my partner. Haven't played this on my own. 

tl;dr two people in a hard-to-control spaceship collect friends and defeat bosses in 2D generated galaxies, pew pew, yay, love is returned! *squeaky noise here*

With two people, it's one of the best couch co-op games I've played on PC, and is very true to the 'co-operative' label. It requires good teamwork, constant communication and occasionally a bit of yelling at each other. The horrifically twee 'storyline' (if I read the word "love" one more time, I might hit someone), very cutesy art style and that little dance thing that happens whenever your characters pass each other can help lighten things a bit when it gets a more tense. I haven't seen another game quite like it.

That said, this isn't a game either of us would play again. There's just enough variety in the game for one playthrough, but probably not more, not with the same person. It was worth the purchase just to try it out though, and I do recommend it. When the four-player comes out, we'll be playing it again with friends. Could be the best/worst double date ever. 

One last thing:  I say controllers are required. We started out sharing my keyboard and I just couldn't get used the controls.

Eigentlich ist Lovers in a  Dangerous Spacetime nicht die Art von Spiel die Ich gerne spiele.
Aber das knuffige Abenteuer ist mir ans Herz gewachsen und zwar aus folgenden Grund.
Unseren Urlaub verbrachten meine Freundin und Ich in Seattle.Natürlich blieb der Computer zuhause und wir dachten das wir unsere Sucht schon unter Konrolle halten würden.Zwischen amerikanischen Frühstück und dem Wahnsinn einer US-Großstadt verging die Zeit auch wie im Flug und es gab nur geringe Entzugserscheinungen.Eines tages besuchten wir das EMP Museum.Besagtes Museum ist eine Offenbarung für Nerds wie uns.Unter anderen gibt es eine Videospielausstellung.
Natürlich waren alle Computer schon belegt.Alle bis auf einen.Auf einer riesigen Leinwand flog ein lustiges buntes Raumschiff umringt von knuffigen Häschen und jeder menge Herzen.Aber egal,Wie 2 verdurstende auf eine Flasche Wasser stürzten wir uns auf die freien Controller und die nächsten Stunden flogen wir von einem Planeten zum nächsten,befreiten enführte Weltraumhäschen und retteten das Universum vor der bösen Anti-Liebe.Als wir wieder aufstanden wurde es schon dunkel und das Museum war fast leer.
Wieder zuhause haben wir das Spiel auch gleich gekauft und beim spielen denken wir immer gerne an den Tag zurück als es uns vor dem real-Life rettete.

20736440.review:
Warning: This is a co-op game, not an online multiplayer game.  Many have been hoping and waiting for an easy multiplayer function for this game, but at this point in time it is a co-op game.

That being said, there's nothing wrong with a co-op game.  Frankly, this hearkens back to those couch gaming days with games that test you and your partner through fun, though admittedly difficult at times, game play.  
Now, for some reason Steam does not show how much time i have actually spent in this game, so do not let that be a bias.  That's a Steam problem, not the game's nor my own.

Game play: Almost solely Co-op.  Requiring much focus, multitasking, and cooperation between players.  COOPERATION IS KEY!  I would not try to play this alone (unless you have multiple controllers and arms) because, while there is AI, it can at times seem overpowered or under-powered as any AI tends to be.  However, the AI companion is either a cat or dog, so there is a slight aesthetic advantage. That said, once you do get used to the game play, it becomes super fun.

Visuals and sound: simply cute and epic, as you can plainly see from the game art.  Bright, colorful, and loud.  The game is stimulating, and just the style makes the game worth playing as it keeps you engrossed in a cute/simple yet somehow simultaneously epic and destructive environment.

Controls: So many would suggest purchasing and programming multiple game controllers/pads, it is personally up to preference.  I remember huddling around one keyboard with friends to play co-op games on PC long ago, and got personally attached to that – not necessarily couch gaming, as you/your friends huddle around a tiny space.  Keyboard gaming really made my friends and I close.  But again, personal preference: keyboard or controller(s).

Story: You (and your buddy) are super cute heroes/creatures tasked with finding pieces of the Ardor Reactor – a machine that harnesses and spreads the power of love; broken by the “Anti-Love”.  Along the way, of course, you shoot  enemies, fly around, explore, save bunnies, and everything else you would expect from super cute space travel with love as its goal.

Length: This game can be played for hours on end, but is more casual and in reality short.  

Final Thoughts: Think C's for this game.  This game is a cute and casual co-op, calling back to couch-gaming.  Controller(s) recommended but not necessary... Oh yeah, and... COOPERATION!

this and gang beasts are the two best games i've seen in a long time, even though neither have online functionality*. that's because, while gang beasts nails compettetive play, this game nails co-operative play.

I can understand that the local only part might put some people off (especially those with small social circles (like me)) but if you've got a friend or sibling that you like to play games with then that's enough to have a great time. they'll (probably) enjoy themselves too, so you're collectively getting twice the enjoyment.

that said, the single-player isn't actually that bad either. sure the AI can't pilot so you're stuck on the helm for most of the time but it can still be fun and since you can tell them what to do it can serve as a break from yelling at your teamate to do something,.. 

you yell at them... and then they do it wrong and you blow up or whack into a wall and you start yelling "Why did you do that!? I clearly told you to do this!!!!" and then your friend protests that they did what you told them to or that it was somehow YOUR fault that THEY messed up.

10/10 would ruin friendships again.
(well... maybe more like 8/10 because there's not enough levels or ships to maintain the replayability)

*bear in mind that I'm quite a shy person and tend to stay away from online multiplayer in general, so my opinion may not be true to your own

20067832.review:
https://youtu.be/9la5k3R9SHo

Lovers in a Dangerous Spacetime is the mouthful of a title given to developer Asteroid Base's inaugural game. I actually got to preview this at PAX Prime earlier this year and it was one of the most popular titles in the indie area and with good reason. Lovers is a cooperative space exploration game where two players must cooperate to man various stations on a spaceship to navigate through space and rescue little space critters. In order to complete a level, a certain number of little space critters has to be rescued for the exit to be unlocked but if you and your partner are feeling like completionists, you can collect all of the critters in each stage to get access to different model ships and unlock other powerups faster. The locations of the critters and the entire world as a whole are totally differently systematically generated on each run, giving every playthrough a fresh feel. Once you find a critter, usually some small challenge has to be completed before you can rescue them. For example, you may have to fight several waves of enemies, escape an explosion or fight a mini boss. 

There are various stations to man on each ship including weapons, shields, engines and a powerful yamato cannon weapon. There are several campaigns that are made up of 4 levels and a final boss fight. Each level offers upgrade crystals that you can install in your systems that will persist throughout the campaign. Deciding which crystals to place in which systems is initially a fun experimental learning process, but I've found once you know what the crystal combinations do, you usually fall into a pattern of upgrading that results in a familiar ship layout each time. But there are also several ship layouts to unlock in the game, each with their own stats and quirky gameplay rules. For instance, there's one unlockable ship that constantly rotates around while you play, making locating and controlling your character within the ship quite a challenge, but as a tradeoff, the ship is also immune to terrain damage. I'm a sucker for these kinds of unlockable gameplay variations and this game reminded me a bit of my favorite FTL from the space exploration and battles right down to the unlockable ships. Obviously the gameplay is nowhere close to the same, but there are similarities to be drawn between the two roguelike space exploration games

There are only two crew members, making coordination and teamwork a key to success in this game. Communication with your partner is necessary and coming up with a good strategy is vital so that you and your teammate aren't running to the same stations to man the same systems. Once you get that strategy established and you and your partner know how to run the ship like seasoned space travelers, it's a really neat feeling. But it's also just as fun to yell and scream at your partner when things are going horribly wrong and your ship is about to explode

Lovers in a Dangerous Spacetime offers the best experiences for couch co-op play. It's conceptually simple to learn and easy to pick up and play. But there's still a decent amount of strategy, skill and depth to be found here as well, and applying these strategies skill and depth of understanding of the game is especially necessary in the later levels where the difficulty gets ratcheted up quite a bit. I really enjoyed this game; it's one of the best couch cooperative experiences I've had. If you and a friend are looking for something to play, you can't go wrong with Lovers in a Dangerous Spacetime

Best played with 2 people this amazing game is a natural contender for a 2015 'Game of the year' award. LOVERS IN A DANGEROUS SPACETIME is a frantic 1- or 2-player couch co-op action space shooter. Explore a colorful galaxy in a massive neon battleship that you control together by manning turrets, lasers, shields and thrusters. Only through teamwork can you triumph over the evil forces of Anti-Love, rescue kidnapped space-bunnies, and avoid a vacuumy demise. Deep space is a dangerous place, but you don’t have to face it alone! 

CO-OP GAMEPLAY 
2 players (or 1 player plus a loyal AI space-pet) need to work together to man the different battle stations, dashing back and forth between weapons, shields and engines. Both players fill important roles at all times, and nobody gets left behind. 

UPGRADEABLE SHIPS 
Find and combine powerful space-gems to customize your ship's load-out. Each gem provides different abilities, letting you learn the right tools for every situation. 

A NEW EXPERIENCE EVERY TIME 
Randomized level layouts mean that both players will be exploring fresh areas every time you play. 

SIMPLE CONTROLS, DEEP CHALLENGE 
Controlling your spacenaut is so simple that anyone can jump in quickly, but getting both players to work together like a well-oiled machine, battling a galaxy of evil robots and constellations — that’s the tricky part. - Highly Recommended!

19687259.review:
[Edit: Warning! Recent Windows updates have totally screwed up access to the 3rd and 4th game controller! While this is still a great game with two people, it is even more fun when Windows doesn't break everything...]

Don't let its syrupy sweet exterior fool you: This is a fierce couch-cooperative bullet storm shooter that will drag even the most dubious gamer into its orbit.  

The overall design is excellent.  There's a tutorial level that is almost a little bit too long and slow, but effectively gives you the basics.  Once you're fully kitted out, the world is yours to explore, and the game doesn't explain anything to you any longer.  What's neat is that it *doesn't have to*.  The game mechanics are easily discoverable and are almost always a delightful surprise instead of an annoying interruption.

The graphics are bright and attractive.  The music is perfect.  The controls are the perfect mix of smooth and frustrating.  
The weapons are nicely balanced so that they never really feel overpowered, never get difficult to use, but still can reward players for their skill.

Now the bad, because there IS bad, I'm afraid:  The game is probably easiest to play with gamepads.  However, in the version shipping when I wrote this, there's some terrible defaults configured, and dual gamepads won't work right.  Gamepad + Keyboard won't work right.  In general, nothing's going to work right with two players right out of the box.  But, if you know that, and are prepared to remap all the controls manually, your patience will be rewarded.

Oh, by the way: The game does have a single-player mode... but you shouldn't really bother with it.  This game should really only be played with two of you side by side.  If you don't have two game pads, and don't have ... uh ... any friends ... then you could skip this game.  Otherwise, you should have this game!

19435835.review:
[h1]Spiel mal wieder mit deiner Besseren Hälfte…![/h1]

Die Geschichte des Actionspiels über die Anti-Liebe, die ein Universum voller Liebe gefährdet, kann man getrost vergessen. Sie liefert nur den Grund, zu zweit in einem Raumschiff durch’s All zu fliegen, zu kämpfen und „kosmische Weltraumhäschen“ zu retten.

Das Gefährt hat Computer für Antrieb, je eine Kanone oben, unten, links und rechts, einen Schild, eine Spezialkanone und (wenn man die Zeit hat) eine Karte. Im Laufe des Spiels kann man die Konsolen mit verschiedenen Juwelen aufrüsten und sich vom jeweiligen Effekt positiv oder auch mal eher negativ überraschen lassen. Im Kampf wechselt man häufig über Leitern von einer Station zur anderen, um sich von dort wieder mit der Außenwelt zu beschäftigen. Dazu sollte man sich mit seinem Spielpartner absprechen, was natürlich schnell in Hektik und einem spaßigen Chaos mündet.

Das Spiel ist eindeutig auf Co-Op ausgelegt. Man kann es zwar auch allein mit einem KI-„Haustier“ spielen, aber seine Wirkung kann es nur im gemeinschaftlichen Chaos entfalten. Außerdem schreit es nach Gamepads. Man kann auch mit der Tastatur spielen, aber Waffen und co lassen sich in deutlich mehr als acht Richtungen ausrichten, und das fällt mit einem Analogstick viel leichter.

Ich habe das Spiel mit meiner besseren Hälfte gespielt. Ihr habe ich das Gamepad in die Hand gedrückt und habe selbst die Tastatur genommen. Weil sie in Sachen Computerspiele unerfahren ist, haben wir den einfachen Schwierigkeitsgrad genommen. Und dann ging’s los. Und sie hat geflucht. Geflucht, dass ein Kesselflicker rot geworden wäre. Ich war mir erstmal nicht sicher, ob sie es nun liebt oder hasst. Aber sie wollte ein andermal weiterspielen. Beim zweiten Mal hat es mit der Zusammenarbeit viel besser geklappt, sie war natürlich immer noch angespannt, wie sich das gehört, aber nicht mehr in Dauerpanik, und wir sind noch besser zurechtgekommen. Ich denke, das verlangt nach einer Fortsetzung…
